accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Memoranda, reports, operations journal, rosters, notes, charts, maps, military studies, and intelligence summaries relating to the operations of the Allied armed forces in, and the Japanese occupation of, Burma during World War II, as well as to operations in the China-Burma-India (CBI) Theater.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: According to a military attaché report accompanying the journal: "This journal covers operations of Chinese and British forces in Burma during the period March 16 - May 2 [1942]. It contains considerable information on Japanese operations and identifications. Supporting it are...documents numbered to correspond to the journal entries shown. Not all journal entries, however, are so supported." The bulk of the materials are the numbered documents supporting the journal entries. Includes declassified records returned to file after January 2016 release by Hoover (documents 24, 67, 84, 92, 115, 136, 147, 164, 179). Also included are notes (typed), outlines of a lecture on the Burma campaign, a summary of the Burma campaign, and a roster of the American Army Forces in China, Burma, and India as of 28 March 1942.
